page.title: 06Education
page.content: Shifnal's schools began as one all age church school in the late 17th century.This was demolished and a new church school for juniors was built.A new state school for infants, and a secondary school for the older children,who did not pass the selection examination, was built in the town. As the town population expanded;due a good rail service and its geographical position, the church junior school was expanded to include infants and the state school was expanded to take juniors.So there were now two primary schools at the opposite ends the town ; each catering for about four hundred children, and a secondary school containing over one thousand pupils.
